an10.111:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha,
an10.111:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an10.111:5.1: “Sir, they speak of this person called ‘a master’.
an10.111:5.2: How is a master mendicant defined?”
an10.111:5.3: “Mendicant, it’s when a mendicant has a master’s right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right mindfulness, right samādhi, right knowledge, and right freedom.
an10.111:5.4: That’s how a mendicant is a master.”
